clinical_study.brief_title: NGS-based Large-panel in Targeted Drug Delivery and Immunotherapy of Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study on Companion Diagnosis by NGS-based Large-panel in Targeted Drug Delivery and Immunotherapy of Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Companion diagnosis by large-panel is in increasing acceptance and need during clinical cancer management. The purpose of this trial is to investigate the benefit of large-panel NGS analysis in companion diagnosis of advanced lung cancer patients and further optimize the parameters.

detailed_description.textblock: Fresh tumor tissues and matched blood cells will be analyzed by large-panel (Berryoncology, lnc.) for multiple molecular biomarkers including mutations with sensitivity/resistance to targeted therapies, tumor mutational burden (TMB), microsatellite instability (MSI) status, etc., Therapeutic approach and outcome will be followed-up to inspect the clinical benefit by large-panel analysis. In addition, selected samples will be analyzed by WES to assess the correctness of TMB estimated by large-panel.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through the whole study period, an average of 3 year
primary_outcome.description: PFS refers to the time from initial treatment to the time of disease progression or death

primary_outcome.time_frame: halfway of the study, an average of 1.5 year
primary_outcome.description: TMB is defined as the total number of detected somatic mutation counts in coding regions per million bases

secondary_outcome.time_frame: halfway of the study, an average of 1.5 year
secondary_outcome.description: The distribution and clinical application value of molecular biomarkers such as Neoantigen, MSI and LOH in Chinese lung cancer patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: halfway of the study, an average of 1.5 year
secondary_outcome.description: The tumor clonality in Chinese lung cancer patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the whole study period, an average of 3 year
secondary_outcome.description: OS refers to the time from the patient entering into the group to the time of death

intervention.intervention_name: The method of gene mutation detection
intervention.description: All samples were detected by large-panel, whereas some of which were also detected by WES.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant aged 18 or above, and gender unrestricted
- Individual with pathologically diagnosed lung cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with concomitant other tumors
- Individual with severe cardiopulmonary insufficiency and hypoproteinemia
- Women who were pregnant and were during their lactation
